The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.

Comments_List: A better understanding of film criticism.
I developed a better ability to look at film critically. Not necessarily its craft, but its substance-- plot, writing, etc.
I learned a lot about how to analyze movies that I didn't know before this class!
I thought it was strong in that it let Prof. Minnis shine on a subject that he clearly loves.
This was an awesome course. The workload was manageable and the film screenings and readings were organized in a way that made a lot of sense.
Honestly, this class is a hidden gem at Yale. No prior experience with the text is really necessary.
Yes! Proffessor Minnis is great and the course itself is really creative
Absolutely, a fun course where you watch cool movies, discuss them, and write about them. Not much work, lots of interesting conversations.
I would definitely recommend this course! The workload is not evenly distributed, so keep that in mind, but it was great as a 5th class.
